item.title: Python and R
item.description: An example of how Python and R can be used together through the use of reticulate library(reticulate) Here we use the numpy library in Python to make a numpy matrix import numpy as np mat1=np.array([[1,2],[3,4]]) Using the Solve function in R, the inverse of the matrix is found mat2<-solve(py$mat1) mat2 ## [,1] [,2] ## [1,] -2.0 1.0 ## [2,] 1.5 -0.5 And we go back to Python to multiply the original matrix with the inverse.
